benchmark_details.name: Hamtajoo (A Persian Plagiarism Checker for Academic Manuscripts)
benchmark_details.overview: Hamtajoo is a Persian plagiarism detection system for academic manuscripts designed to investigate patterns of text re-use in Persian academic papers, addressing the challenges of plagiarism in less-resourced languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop an efficient plagiarism detection system tailored to the complexities of the Persian language and academic writing.

data.source: A reference collection of Persian academic papers indexed by SID (Scientific Information Database).

methodology.calculation: Performance metrics are computed based on comparisons of detected plagiarism to known instances in the corpus.
methodology.interpretation: Higher recall indicates better detection of plagiarized content, while higher precision means fewer false positives.
methodology.baseline_results: Hamtajoo achieved the second rank in recall measure and the best results in runtime during evaluations against other plagiarism detection systems.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated using standard datasets from PAN Plagiarism Detection competitions.
